name: ML-Powered Personalized Recommendations
description: Test hypothesis that personalized product recommendations increase engagement and revenue

inputs.featureIdea: Display ML-powered personalized product recommendations on homepage based on browsing and purchase history

expectedHypothesis.statement: We believe showing ML-powered personalized recommendations for returning customers will increase recommendation click-through rate from 5% to 8% and revenue per session by 12%. We'll know we're right when both metrics show statistically significant improvement.
assumptions: ML model can accurately predict user preferences
Users want personalized recommendations (vs. generic popular items)
Browsing history is a strong signal for future interest
Users are aware recommendations are personalized
risks: Increased infrastructure costs from ML inference

counter: Category diversity purchased (watch for filter bubble)

notes: This experiment requires ML model training and deployment infrastructure. Consider starting with simpler collaborative filtering before full personalization.
